a:22:{s:7:"akismet";O:8:"stdClass":26:{s:4:"name";s:17:"Akismet Anti-Spam";s:4:"slug";s:7:"akismet";s:7:"version";s:5:"4.0.8";s:6:"author";s:66:"<a href="https://automattic.com/wordpress-plugins/">Automattic</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:41:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/automattic";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.0";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.8";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";d:94;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:700;i:4;i:37;i:3;i:11;i:2;i:5;i:1;i:33;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:786;s:15:"support_threads";i:13;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:11;s:10:"downloaded";i:118361386;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2018-06-19 6:18pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2005-10-20";s:8:"homepage";s:20:"https://akismet.com/";s:8:"sections";a:3:{s:11:"description";s:1059:"<p>Akismet checks your comments and contact form submissions against our global database of spam to prevent your site from publishing malicious content. You can review the comment spam it catches on your blog&#8217;s &#8220;Comments&#8221; admin screen.</p>
<p>Major features in Akismet include:</p>
<ul>
<li>Automatically checks all comments and filters out the ones that look like spam.</li>
<li>Each comment has a status history, so you can easily see which comments were caught or cleared by Akismet and which were spammed or unspammed by a moderator.</li>
<li>URLs are shown in the comment body to reveal hidden or misleading links.</li>
<li>Moderators can see the number of approved comments for each user.</li>
<li>A discard feature that outright blocks the worst spam, saving you disk space and speeding up your site.</li>
</ul>
<p>PS: You&#8217;ll need an <a href="https://akismet.com/get/" rel="nofollow">Akismet.com API key</a> to use it.  Keys are free for personal blogs; paid subscriptions are available for businesses and commercial sites.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:186:"<p>Upload the Akismet plugin to your blog, Activate it, then enter your <a href="https://akismet.com/get/" rel="nofollow">Akismet.com API key</a>.</p>
<p>1, 2, 3: You&#8217;re done!</p>
";s:9:"changelog";s:21147:"<h4>4.0.8</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 19 June 2018</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Improved the grammar and consistency of the in-admin privacy related notes (notice and config).</li>
<li>Revised in-admin explanation of the comment form privacy notice to make its usage clearer.</li>
<li>Added <code>rel="nofollow noopener"</code> to the comment form privacy notice to improve SEO and security.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.7</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 28 May 2018</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Based on user feedback, the link on &#8220;Learn how your comment data is processed.&#8221; in the optional privacy notice now has a <code>target</code> of <code>_blank</code> and opens in a new tab/window.</li>
<li>Updated the in-admin privacy notice to use the term &#8220;comment&#8221; instead of &#8220;contact&#8221; in &#8220;Akismet can display a notice to your users under your comment forms.&#8221;</li>
<li>Only show in-admin privacy notice if Akismet has an API Key configured</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.6</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 26 May 2018</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Moved away from using <code>empty( get_option() )</code> to instantiating a variable to be compatible with older versions of PHP (5.3, 5.4, etc).</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.5</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 26 May 2018</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Corrected version number after tagging. Sorry&#8230;</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.4</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 26 May 2018</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Added a hook to provide Akismet-specific privacy information for a site&#8217;s privacy policy.</li>
<li>Added tools to control the display of a privacy related notice under comment forms.</li>
<li>Fixed HTML in activation failure message to close META and HEAD tag properly.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that would sometimes prevent Akismet from being correctly auto-configured.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.3</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 19 February 2018</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Added a scheduled task to remove entries in wp_commentmeta that no longer have corresponding comments in wp_comments.</li>
<li>Added a new <code>akismet_batch_delete_count</code> action to the batch delete methods for people who&#8217;d like to keep track of the numbers of records being processed by those methods.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.2</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 18 December 2017</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a bug that could cause Akismet to recheck a comment that has already been manually approved or marked as spam.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that could cause Akismet to claim that some comments are still waiting to be checked when no comments are waiting to be checked.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.1</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 6 November 2017</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a bug that could prevent some users from connecting Akismet via their Jetpack connection.</li>
<li>Ensured that any pending Akismet-related events are unscheduled if the plugin is deactivated.</li>
<li>Allow some JavaScript to be run asynchronously to avoid affecting page render speeds.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 19 September 2017</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Added REST API endpoints for configuring Akismet and retrieving stats.</li>
<li>Increased the minimum supported WordPress version to 4.0.</li>
<li>Added compatibility with comments submitted via the REST API.</li>
<li>Improved the progress indicator on the &#8220;Check for Spam&#8221; button.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.3.4</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 3 August 2017</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Disabled Akismet&#8217;s debug log output by default unless AKISMET_DEBUG is defined.</li>
<li>URL previews now begin preloading when the mouse moves near them in the comments section of wp-admin.</li>
<li>When a comment is caught by the Comment Blacklist, Akismet will always allow it to stay in the trash even if it is spam as well.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that was preventing an error from being shown when a site can&#8217;t reach Akismet&#8217;s servers.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.3.3</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 13 July 2017</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Reduced amount of bandwidth used by the URL Preview feature.</li>
<li>Improved the admin UI when the API key is manually pre-defined for the site.</li>
<li>Removed a workaround for WordPress installations older than 3.3 that will improve Akismet&#8217;s compatibility with other plugins.</li>
<li>The number of spam blocked that is displayed on the WordPress dashboard will now be more accurate and updated more frequently.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug in the Akismet widget that could cause PHP warnings.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.3.2</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 10 May 2017</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a bug causing JavaScript errors in some browsers.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.3.1</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 2 May 2017</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Improve performance by only requesting the akismet_comment_nonce option when absolutely necessary.</li>
<li>Fixed two bugs that could cause PHP warnings.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that was preventing the &#8220;Remove author URL&#8221; feature from working after a comment was edited using &#8220;Quick Edit.&#8221;</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that was preventing the URL preview feature from working after a comment was edited using &#8220;Quick Edit.&#8221;</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.3</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 23 February 2017</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Updated the Akismet admin pages with a new clean design.</li>
<li>Fixed bugs preventing the <code>akismet_add_comment_nonce</code> and <code>akismet_update_alert</code> wrapper functions from working properly.</li>
<li>Fixed bug preventing the loading indicator from appearing when re-checking all comments for spam.</li>
<li>Added a progress indicator to the &#8220;Check for Spam&#8221; button.</li>
<li>Added a success message after manually rechecking the Pending queue for spam.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.2</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 6 September 2016</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Added a WP-CLI module. You can now check comments and recheck the moderation queue from the command line.</li>
<li>Stopped using the deprecated jQuery function <code>.live()</code>.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug in <code>remove_comment_author_url()</code> and <code>add_comment_author_url()</code> that could generate PHP notices.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that could cause an infinite loop for sites with very very very large comment IDs.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that could cause the Akismet widget title to be blank.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.11</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 12 May 2016</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a bug that could cause the &#8220;Check for Spam&#8221; button to skip some comments.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that could prevent some spam submissions from being sent to Akismet.</li>
<li>Updated all links to use https:// when possible.</li>
<li>Disabled Akismet debug logging unless WP_DEBUG and WP_DEBUG_LOG are both enabled.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.10</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 1 April 2016</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a bug that could cause comments caught as spam to be placed in the Pending queue.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that could have resulted in comments that were caught by the core WordPress comment blacklist not to have a corresponding History entry.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that could have caused avoidable PHP warnings in the error log.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.9</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 28 March 2016</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Add compatibility with Jetpack so that Jetpack can automatically configure Akismet settings when appropriate.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug preventing some comment data from being sent to Akismet.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.8</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 4 March 2016</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a bug preventing Akismet from being used with some plugins that rewrite admin URLs.</li>
<li>Reduced the amount of bandwidth used on Akismet API calls</li>
<li>Reduced the amount of space Akismet uses in the database</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that could cause comments caught as spam to be placed in the Pending queue.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.7</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 4 January 2016</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Added documentation for the &#8216;akismet_comment_nonce&#8217; filter.</li>
<li>The post-install activation button is now accessible to screen readers and keyboard-only users.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that was preventing the &#8220;Remove author URL&#8221; feature from working in WordPress 4.4</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.6</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 14 December 2015</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Improve the notices shown after activating Akismet.</li>
<li>Update some strings to allow for the proper plural forms in all languages.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.5</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 13 October 2015</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Closes a potential XSS vulnerability.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.4</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 24 September 2015</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a bug that was preventing some users from automatically connecting using Jetpack if they didn&#8217;t have a current Akismet subscription.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that could cause comments caught as spam to be placed in the Pending queue.</li>
<li>Error messages and instructions have been simplified to be more understandable.</li>
<li>Link previews are enabled for all links inside comments, not just the author&#8217;s website link.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.3</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 6 July 2015</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Notify users when their account status changes after previously being successfully set up. This should help any users who are seeing blank Akismet settings screens.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.2</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 7 June 2015</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Reduced the amount of space Akismet uses in the commentmeta table.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug where some comments with quotes in the author name weren&#8217;t getting history entries</li>
<li>Pre-emptive security improvements to ensure that the Akismet plugin can&#8217;t be used by attackers to compromise a WordPress installation.</li>
<li>Better UI for the key entry field: allow whitespace to be included at the beginning or end of the key and strip it out automatically when the form is submitted.</li>
<li>When deactivating the plugin, notify the Akismet API so the site can be marked as inactive.</li>
<li>Clearer error messages.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.1</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 17th March, 2015</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Improvements to the &#8220;Remove comment author URL&#8221; JavaScript</li>
<li>Include the pingback pre-check from the 2.6 branch.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 11th March, 2015</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Use HTTPS by default for all requests to Akismet.</li>
<li>Fix for a situation where Akismet might strip HTML from a comment.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.4</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 11th December, 2014</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fix to make .htaccess compatible with Apache 2.4.</li>
<li>Fix to allow removal of https author URLs.</li>
<li>Fix to avoid stripping part of the author URL when removing and re-adding.</li>
<li>Removed the &#8220;Check for Spam&#8221; button from the &#8220;Trash&#8221; and &#8220;Approved&#8221; queues, where it would have no effect.</li>
<li>Allow automatic API key configuration when Jetpack is installed and connected to a WordPress.com account</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.3</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 3rd November, 2014</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fix for sending the wrong data to delete_comment action that could have prevented old spam comments from being deleted.</li>
<li>Added a filter to disable logging of Akismet debugging information.</li>
<li>Added a filter for the maximum comment age when deleting old spam comments.</li>
<li>Added a filter for the number per batch when deleting old spam comments.</li>
<li>Removed the &#8220;Check for Spam&#8221; button from the Spam folder.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.2</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 18th August, 2014</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Performance improvements.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that could truncate the comment data being sent to Akismet for checking.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.1</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 9th July, 2014</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Removed dependency on PHP&#8217;s fsockopen function</li>
<li>Fix spam/ham reports to work when reported outside of the WP dashboard, e.g., from Notifications or the WP app</li>
<li>Remove jQuery dependency for comment form JavaScript</li>
<li>Remove unnecessary data from some Akismet comment meta</li>
<li>Suspended keys will now result in all comments being put in moderation, not spam.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.0</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 15th April, 2014</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Move Akismet to Settings menu</li>
<li>Drop Akismet Stats menu</li>
<li>Add stats snapshot to Akismet settings</li>
<li>Add Akismet subscription details and status to Akismet settings</li>
<li>Add contextual help for each page</li>
<li>Improve Akismet setup to use Jetpack to automate plugin setup</li>
<li>Fix &#8220;Check for Spam&#8221; to use AJAX to avoid page timing out</li>
<li>Fix Akismet settings page to be responsive</li>
<li>Drop legacy code</li>
<li>Tidy up CSS and Javascript</li>
<li>Replace the old discard setting with a new &#8220;discard pervasive spam&#8221; feature.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.0</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 18th March, 2014</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Add ajax paging to the check for spam button to handle large volumes of comments</li>
<li>Optimize javascript and add localization support</li>
<li>Fix bug in link to spam comments from right now dashboard widget</li>
<li>Fix bug with deleting old comments to avoid timeouts dealing with large volumes of comments</li>
<li>Include X-Pingback-Forwarded-For header in outbound WordPress pingback verifications</li>
<li>Add pre-check for pingbacks, to stop spam before an outbound verification request is made</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.9</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 1st August, 2013</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Update &#8216;Already have a key&#8217; link to redirect page rather than depend on javascript</li>
<li>Fix some non-translatable strings to be translatable</li>
<li>Update Activation banner in plugins page to redirect user to Akismet config page</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.8</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 20th January, 2013</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Simplify the activation process for new users</li>
<li>Remove the reporter_ip parameter</li>
<li>Minor preventative security improvements</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.7</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 13th December, 2012</em></p>
<ul>
<li>FireFox Stats iframe preview bug</li>
<li>Fix mshots preview when using https</li>
<li>Add .htaccess to block direct access to files</li>
<li>Prevent some PHP notices</li>
<li>Fix Check For Spam return location when referrer is empty</li>
<li>Fix Settings links for network admins</li>
<li>Fix prepare() warnings in WP 3.5</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.6</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 26th April, 2012</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Prevent retry scheduling problems on sites where wp_cron is misbehaving</li>
<li>Preload mshot previews</li>
<li>Modernize the widget code</li>
<li>Fix a bug where comments were not held for moderation during an error condition</li>
<li>Improve the UX and display when comments are temporarily held due to an error</li>
<li>Make the Check For Spam button force a retry when comments are held due to an error</li>
<li>Handle errors caused by an invalid key</li>
<li>Don&#8217;t retry comments that are too old</li>
<li>Improve error messages when verifying an API key</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.5</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 11th January, 2012</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Add nonce check for comment author URL remove action</li>
<li>Fix the settings link</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.4</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 5th January, 2012</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Limit Akismet CSS and Javascript loading in wp-admin to just the pages that need it</li>
<li>Added author URL quick removal functionality</li>
<li>Added mShot preview on Author URL hover</li>
<li>Added empty index.php to prevent directory listing</li>
<li>Move wp-admin menu items under Jetpack, if it is installed</li>
<li>Purge old Akismet comment meta data, default of 15 days</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.3</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 8th Febuary, 2011</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Specify the license is GPL v2 or later</li>
<li>Fix a bug that could result in orphaned commentmeta entries</li>
<li>Include hotfix for WordPress 3.0.5 filter issue</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.2</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 14th January, 2011</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Properly format the comment count for author counts</li>
<li>Look for super admins on multisite installs when looking up user roles</li>
<li>Increase the HTTP request timeout</li>
<li>Removed padding for author approved count</li>
<li>Fix typo in function name</li>
<li>Set Akismet stats iframe height to fixed 2500px.  Better to have one tall scroll bar than two side by side.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.1</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 17th December, 2010</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fix a bug that caused the &#8220;Auto delete&#8221; option to fail to discard comments correctly</li>
<li>Remove the comment nonce form field from the &#8216;Akismet Configuration&#8217; page in favor of using a filter, akismet_comment_nonce</li>
<li>Fixed padding bug in &#8220;author&#8221; column of posts screen</li>
<li>Added margin-top to &#8220;cleared by &#8230;&#8221; badges on dashboard</li>
<li>Fix possible error when calling akismet_cron_recheck()</li>
<li>Fix more PHP warnings</li>
<li>Clean up XHTML warnings for comment nonce</li>
<li>Fix for possible condition where scheduled comment re-checks could get stuck</li>
<li>Clean up the comment meta details after deleting a comment</li>
<li>Only show the status badge if the comment status has been changed by someone/something other than Akismet</li>
<li>Show a &#8216;History&#8217; link in the row-actions</li>
<li>Translation fixes</li>
<li>Reduced font-size on author name</li>
<li>Moved &#8220;flagged by&#8230;&#8221; notification to top right corner of comment container and removed heavy styling</li>
<li>Hid &#8220;flagged by&#8230;&#8221; notification while on dashboard</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.0</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 7th December, 2010</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Track comment actions under &#8216;Akismet Status&#8217; on the edit comment screen</li>
<li>Fix a few remaining deprecated function calls ( props Mike Glendinning )</li>
<li>Use HTTPS for the stats IFRAME when wp-admin is using HTTPS</li>
<li>Use the WordPress HTTP class if available</li>
<li>Move the admin UI code to a separate file, only loaded when needed</li>
<li>Add cron retry feature, to replace the old connectivity check</li>
<li>Display Akismet status badge beside each comment</li>
<li>Record history for each comment, and display it on the edit page</li>
<li>Record the complete comment as originally submitted in comment_meta, to use when reporting spam and ham</li>
<li>Highlight links in comment content</li>
<li>New option, &#8220;Show the number of comments you&#8217;ve approved beside each comment author.&#8221;</li>
<li>New option, &#8220;Use a nonce on the comment form.&#8221;</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.4.0</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 23rd August, 2010</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Spell out that the license is GPLv2</li>
<li>Fix PHP warnings</li>
<li>Fix WordPress deprecated function calls</li>
<li>Fire the delete_comment action when deleting comments</li>
<li>Move code specific for older WP versions to legacy.php</li>
<li>General code clean up</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.3.0</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 5th June, 2010</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8220;Are you sure&#8221; nonce message on config screen in WPMU</li>
<li>Fix XHTML compliance issue in sidebar widget</li>
<li>Change author link; remove some old references to WordPress.com accounts</li>
<li>Localize the widget title (core ticket #13879)</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.2.9</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 2nd June, 2010</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Eliminate a potential conflict with some plugins that may cause spurious reports</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.2.8</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 27th May, 2010</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fix bug in initial comment check for ipv6 addresses</li>
<li>Report comments as ham when they are moved from spam to moderation</li>
<li>Report comments as ham when clicking undo after spam</li>
<li>Use transition_comment_status action when available instead of older actions for spam/ham submissions</li>
<li>Better diagnostic messages when PHP network functions are unavailable</li>
<li>Better handling of comments by logged-in users</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.2.7</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 17th December, 2009</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Add a new AKISMET_VERSION constant</li>
<li>Reduce the possibility of over-counting spam when another spam filter plugin is in use</li>
<li>Disable the connectivity check when the API key is hard-coded for WPMU</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.2.6</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 20th July, 2009</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fix a global warning introduced in 2.2.5</li>
<li>Add changelog and additional readme.txt tags</li>
<li>Fix an array conversion warning in some versions of PHP</li>
<li>Support a new WPCOM_API_KEY constant for easier use with WordPress MU</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.2.5</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 13th July, 2009</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Include a new Server Connectivity diagnostic check, to detect problems caused by firewalls</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.2.4</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 3rd June, 2009</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a key problem affecting the stats feature in WordPress MU</li>
<li>Provide additional blog information in Akismet API calls</li>
</ul>
";}s:17:"short_description";s:146:"Akismet checks your comments and contact form submissions against our global database of spam to protect you and your site from malicious Privacy Policies";s:4:"slug";s:24:"akismet-privacy-policies";s:7:"version";s:5:"1.1.2";s:6:"author";s:46:"<a href="http://inpsyde.com/">Inpsyde GmbH</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:38:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/inpsyde";s:8:"requires";s:3:"3.0";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.8";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";d:100;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:1;i:4;i:0;i:3;i:0;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:0;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:1;s:15:"support_threads";i:0;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:0;s:10:"downloaded";i:143893;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2018-04-03 8:22pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2011-03-22";s:8:"homepage";s:16:"http://wpde.org/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:624:"<p>Der Einsatz des Anti-Spam-Plugins Akismet ist in Deutschland aus datenschutzrechtlichen Aspekten sehr bedenklich, da personenbezogene Daten auf Servern in den USA gespeichert werden.</p>
<p>Um keine Angriffsfläche für Abmahnungen zu bieten, muss man die Benutzer vor dem Kommentieren auf das Speichern dieser Daten hinweisen. Dies übernimmt das Plugin.</p>
<h4>Erstellt durch Inpsyde</h4>
<p>Das Team der <a href="https://inpsyde.com" rel="nofollow">Inpsyde</a> entwickelt im Web und WordPress seit 2006.</p>
<h4>Spenden?</h4>
<p>Du möchtest etwas spenden &#8211; wir bevorzugen ein positives Review, nicht mehr.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:754:"<ol>
<li>Plugin herunterladen, entpacken, in den Ordner <code>wp-content/plugins/</code> laden und aktivieren. Oder direkt über den Adminbereich und &#8216;Plugins&#8217; &#8211; &#8216;Installieren&#8217; das Plugin suchen und installieren.</li>
<li>
<p>Das Plugin sollte nun automatisch unter dem Kommentarfeld den Hinweistext anzeigen. Falls nicht, muss im Theme (z.B. comments.php) manuell folgender Code innerhalb des Kommentar-Formulares, innerhalb <code>&lt;form&gt;...&lt;/form&gt;</code> &#8211; da wo der Hinweis erscheinen soll, eingefügt werden:</p>
<pre><code>&lt;?php do_action( 'akismet_privacy_policies' ); ?&gt;
</code></pre>
</li>
</ol>
<p>Der Aufruf muss an der Stelle des Templates statt finden, wo die Ausgabe erscheinen soll.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:1570:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<ol>
<li>Plugin herunterladen, entpacken, in den Ordner <code>wp-content/plugins/</code> laden und aktivieren. Oder direkt über den Adminbereich und &#8216;Plugins&#8217; &#8211; &#8216;Installieren&#8217; das Plugin suchen und installieren.</li>
<li>
<p>Das Plugin sollte nun automatisch unter dem Kommentarfeld den Hinweistext anzeigen. Falls nicht, muss im Theme (z.B. comments.php) manuell folgender Code innerhalb des Kommentar-Formulares, innerhalb <code>&lt;form&gt;...&lt;/form&gt;</code> &#8211; da wo der Hinweis erscheinen soll, eingefügt werden:</p>
<pre><code>&lt;?php do_action( 'akismet_privacy_policies' ); ?&gt;
</code></pre>
</li>
</ol>
<p>Der Aufruf muss an der Stelle des Templates statt finden, wo die Ausgabe erscheinen soll.</p>
</p>
<h4>Wo finde ich weitere Informationen zum Thema Datenschutz und Akismet?</h4>
<p>
<p>Wir haben bei WordPress Deutschland einen <a href="http://http://faq.wpde.org/hinweise-zum-datenschutz-beim-einsatz-von-akismet-in-deutschland/" title="FAQ-Artikel zu Akismet" rel="nofollow">FAQ-Artikel</a>.</p>
<p>Rechtsanwalt Thomas Schwenke klärt in einem Artikel auf: <a href="http://spreerecht.de/datenschutz/2011-04/usability-vs-datenschutz-datenschutzrechtliche-einwilligung-ohne-opt-in" rel="nofollow">Usability VS Datenschutz – Datenschutzrechtliche Einwilligung ohne Opt-In?</a></p>
</p>
<h4>Plugin Dokumentation</h4>
<p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github.com/inpsyde/Akismet-Privacy-Policies/wiki/Hook-Documentation" rel="nofollow">Hook-Documentation</a></li>
</ul>
</p>

WordPress";}}s:4:"tags";a:3:{s:7:"akismet";s:7:"akismet";s:7:"privacy";s:7:"privacy";s:4:"spam";s:4:"spam";}s:8:"versions";a:5:{s:5:"1.0.0";s:73:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/akismet-privacy-policies.1.0.0.zip";s:5:"1.1.0";s:73:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/akismet-privacy-policies.1.1.0.zip";s:5:"1.1.1";s:73:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/akismet-privacy-policies.1.1.1.zip";s:5:"1.1.2";s:73:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/akismet-privacy-policies.1.1.2.zip";s:5:"trunk";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/akismet-privacy-policies.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:0:"";s:5:"icons";a:1:{s:7:"default";s:68:"https://s.w.org/plugins/geopattern-icon/akismet-privacy-policies.svg";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}}s:14:"contact-form-7";O:8:"stdClass":26:{s:4:"name";s:14:"Contact Form 7";s:4:"slug";s:14:"contact-form-7";s:7:"version";s:5:"5.0.4";s:6:"author";s:62:"<a href="https://ideasilo.wordpress.com/">Takayuki Miyoshi</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:43:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/takayukister";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.8";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.8";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";d:90;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:1089;i:4;i:112;i:3;i:35;i:2;i:30;i:1;i:120;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:1386;s:15:"support_threads";i:456;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:102;s:10:"downloaded";i:93224627;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2018-09-04 5:26pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2007-08-02";s:8:"homepage";s:25:"https://contactform7.com/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:2779:"<p>Contact Form 7 can manage multiple contact forms, plus you can customize the form and the mail contents flexibly with simple markup. The form supports Ajax-powered submitting, CAPTCHA, Akismet spam filtering and so on.</p>
<h4>Docs &amp; Support</h4>
<p>You can find <a href="https://contactform7.com/docs/" rel="nofollow">docs</a>, <a href="https://contactform7.com/faq/" rel="nofollow">FAQ</a> and more detailed information about Contact Form 7 on <a href="https://contactform7.com/" rel="nofollow">contactform7.com</a>. If you were unable to find the answer to your question on the FAQ or in any of the documentation, you should check the <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/contact-form-7/" rel="nofollow">support forum</a> on WordPress.org. If you can&#8217;t locate any topics that pertain to your particular issue, post a new topic for it.</p>
<h4>Contact Form 7 Needs Your Support</h4>
<p>It is hard to continue development and support for this free plugin without contributions from users like you. If you enjoy using Contact Form 7 and find it useful, please consider <a href="https://contactform7.com/donate/" rel="nofollow"><strong>making a donation</strong></a>. Your donation will help encourage and support the plugin&#8217;s continued development and better user support.</p>
<h4>Privacy Notices</h4>
<p>With the default configuration, this plugin, in itself, does not:</p>
<ul>
<li>track users by stealth;</li>
<li>write any user personal data to the database;</li>
<li>send any data to external servers;</li>
<li>use cookies.</li>
</ul>
<p>If you activate certain features in this plugin, the contact form submitter&#8217;s personal data, including their IP address, may be sent to the service provider. Thus, confirming the provider&#8217;s privacy policy is recommended. These features include:</p>
<ul>
<li>reCAPTCHA (<a href="https://policies.google.com/?hl=en" rel="nofollow">Google</a>)</li>
<li>Akismet (<a href="https://automattic.com/privacy/" rel="nofollow">Automattic</a>)</li>
</ul>
<h4>Recommended Plugins</h4>
<p>The following plugins are recommended for Contact Form 7 users:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/flamingo/">Flamingo</a> by Takayuki Miyoshi &#8211; With Flamingo, you can save submitted messages via contact forms in the database.</li>
<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/bogo/">Bogo</a> by Takayuki Miyoshi &#8211; Bogo is a straight-forward multilingual plugin that doesn&#8217;t cause headaches.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Translations</h4>
<p>You can <a href="https://contactform7.com/translating-contact-form-7/" rel="nofollow">translate Contact Form 7</a> on <a href="https://translate.wordpress.org/projects/wp-plugins/contact-form-7" rel="nofollow"><strong>translate.wordpress.org</strong></a>.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:414:"<ol>
<li>Upload the entire <code>contact-form-7</code> folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory.</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress.</li>
</ol>
<p>You will find &#8216;Contact&#8217; menu in your WordPress admin panel.</p>
<p>For basic usage, you can also have a look at the <a href="https://contactform7.com/" rel="nofollow">plugin web site</a>.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:442:"<p>Do you have questions or issues with Contact Form 7? Use these support channels appropriately.</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:3628:"<p>For more information, see <a href="https://contactform7.com/category/releases/" rel="nofollow">Releases</a>.</p>
<h4>5.0.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>Specifies the capability_type argument explicitly in the register_post_type() call to fix the privilege escalation vulnerability issue.</li>
<li>Local File Attachment – disallows the specifying of absolute file paths referring to files outside the wp-content directory.</li>
<li>Config Validator – adds a test item to detect invalid file attachment settings.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug in the JavaScript fallback function for legacy browsers that do not support the HTML5 placeholder attribute.</li>
<li>Acceptance Checkbox – unsets the form-tag&#8217;s do-not-store feature.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.0.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>CSS: Applies the &#8220;not-allowed&#8221; cursor style to submit buttons in the &#8220;disabled&#8221; state.</li>
<li>Acceptance Checkbox: Revises the tag-generator UI to encourage the use of better options in terms of personal data protection.</li>
<li>Introduces wpcf7_anonymize_ip_addr() function.</li>
<li>Introduces the consent_for:storage option for all types of form-tags.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.0.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added the Privacy Notices section to the readme.txt file.</li>
<li>Updated the Information meta-box content.</li>
<li>Use get_user_locale() instead of get_locale() where it is more appropriate.</li>
<li>Acceptance Checkbox: Reset submit buttons’ disabled status after a successful submission.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.0.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed incorrect uses of _n().</li>
<li>Config validation: Fixed incorrect count of alerts in the Additional Settings tab panel.</li>
<li>Config validation: Fixed improper treatment for the [_site_admin_email] special mail-tag in the From mail header field.</li>
<li>Acceptance checkbox: The class and id attributes specified were applied to the wrong HTML element.</li>
<li>Config validation: When there is an additional mail header for mailboxes like Cc or Reply-To, but it has a possible empty value, “Invalid mailbox syntax is used” error will be returned.</li>
<li>Explicitly specify the fourth parameter of add_action() to avoid passing unintended parameter values.</li>
<li>Check if the target directory is empty before removing the directory.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Additional settings: on_sent_ok and on_submit have been removed.</li>
<li>New additional setting: skip_mail</li>
<li>Flamingo: Inbound channel title changes in conjunction with a change in the title of the corresponding contact form.</li>
<li>DOM events: Make an entire API response object accessible through the event.detail.apiResponse property.</li>
<li>HTML mail: Adds language-related attributes to the HTML header.</li>
<li>File upload: Sets the accept attribute to an uploading field.</li>
<li>Introduces the WPCF7_MailTag class.</li>
<li>Allows aborting a mail-sending attempt using the wpcf7_before_send_mail action hook. Also, you can set a custom status and a message through the action hook.</li>
<li>Acceptance checkbox: Allows the specifying of a statement of conditions in the form-tag’s content part.</li>
<li>Acceptance checkbox: Supports the optional option.</li>
<li>New special mail tags: [_site_title], [_site_description], [_site_url], [_site_admin_email], [_invalid_fields], [_user_login], [_user_email], [_user_url], [_user_first_name], [_user_last_name], [_user_nickname], and [_user_display_name]</li>
<li>New filter hooks: wpcf7_upload_file_name, wpcf7_autop_or_not, wpcf7_posted_data_{$type}, and wpcf7_mail_tag_replaced_{$type}</li>
<li>New form-tag features: zero-controls-container and not-for-mail</li>
</ul>
";s:11:"screenshots";s:225:"<ol><li><a href="https://ps.w.org/contact-form-7/assets/screenshot-1.png?rev=1176454"><img src="https://ps.w.org/contact-form-7/assets/screenshot-1.png?rev=1176454" alt="screenshot-1.png"></a><p>screenshot-1.png</p></li></ol>";}s:17:"short_description";s:54:"Just another contact form plugin. Simple but flexible.";s:13:"download_link";s:63:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/contact-form-7.5.0.4.zip";s:11:"screenshots";a:1:{i:1;a:2:{s:3:"src";s:67:"https://ps.w.org/contact-form-7/assets/screenshot-1.png?rev=1176454";s:7:"caption";s:16:"screenshot-1.png";}}s:4:"tags";a:5:{s:7:"contact";s:7:"contact";s:12:"contact-form";s:12:"contact AWD All in one";s:4:"slug";s:12:"facebook-awd";s:7:"version";s:3:"1.6";s:6:"author";s:45:"<a href="http://www.ahwebdev.fr">AHWEBDEV</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:39:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/ahwebdev";s:8:"requires";s:3:"3.3";s:6:"tested";s:5:"3.5.2";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";d:100;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:2;i:4;i:0;i:3;i:0;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:0;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:2;s:15:"support_threads";i:0;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:0;s:10:"downloaded";i:130714;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2013-01-23 1:08am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2011-06-05";s:8:"homepage";s:31:"http://facebook-awd.ahwebdev.fr";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:2607:"<p><a href="http://facebook-awd.ahwebdev.fr/" title="" rel="nofollow">Facebook AWD</a> is an all in one Facebook capabilities for wordpress.<br />
Easy to install.<br />
Add Socials plugins, OpenGraph, Comments, FB connect and more.<br />
Publish your content to all your FB pages and on your personnal wall on Facebook<br />
Add Like button and comments to pages, posts and custom posts types, at top, bottom or both.<br />
Widgets and Shortcodes available for each Facebook socials plugins.<br />
Works in Facebook Tabs and Facebook Canvas!<br />
Use both SDK&#8217;s PHP AND Javascript</p>
<h4>Socials plugins Iframe or Xfbml or Html5:</h4>
<ul>
<li>Like Button</li>
<li>Like Box</li>
<li>Activity Box</li>
<li>Shared Activity</li>
<li>Facebook Connect &amp; Login Button </li>
<li>Comments</li>
</ul>
<h4>Get More Features</h4>
<ul>
<li><a href="http://facebook-awd.ahwebdev.fr/plugins/" title="See all plugins of Facebook AWD" rel="nofollow">Sub plugins list</a></li>
</ul>
<h4>Langs:</h4>
<ul>
<li>EN (en_US)</li>
</ul>
<h4>OpenGraph protocol:</h4>
<p>Customise Open Graph Tags for each type of posts (custom post type support), archives, categories and taxonomies, attachements<br />
You can redefine settings individually for all posts or pages or custom post type<br />
Add your own meta and create custom objects.</p>
<h4>FB connect &amp; Realtime Api:</h4>
<p>If FB connect enable, you can ask special permissions, and link Facebook user with your site. Use avatars from Facebook instead defaults.<br />
When a user is logging in to your site using Facebook, this plugin will auto register user. If user unregister from Facebook, his account will be not remove.<br />
If you are a developer you can use the API of facebook and opengraph api directly from your themes and plugins.<br />
Simply use defined objects that were set by this plugin.<br />
Optional: you can use the real time api to keep users&#8217;s data sync with your database.</p>
<h4>Widget And Shortcodes:</h4>
<p>You can use widgets and shotcodes to display Facebook socials plugins</p>
<ul>
<li>Like Button</li>
<li>Like Box [AWD_likebox]</li>
<li>Activity Box [AWD_activitybox]</li>
<li>Shared Activity [AWD_shared_activitybox]</li>
<li>Facebook Connect &amp; Login Button [AWD_loginbutton]</li>
<li>Comments Box [AWD_comments]</li>
</ul>
<h4>Multisite compatible:</h4>
<p>This plugin is compatible with WordPress multisite.<br />
<a href="http://facebook-awd.ahwebdev.fr/support/" title="" rel="nofollow">Support</a><br />
<a href="http://facebook-awd.ahwebdev.fr/documentation/" title="" rel="nofollow">Documentation</a></p>

4 Framework";s:4:"slug";s:6:"gantry";s:7:"version";s:6:"4.1.16";s:6:"author";s:62:"<a href="http://www.rockettheme.com/wordpress">RocketTheme</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:37:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/gantry";s:8:"requires";s:3:"3.2";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.8";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";d:78;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:10;i:4;i:0;i:3;i:0;i:2;i:1;i:1;i:3;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:14;s:15:"support_threads";i:0;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:0;s:10:"downloaded";i:284448;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2018-08-10 4:54pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2011-09-20";s:8:"homepage";s:22:"http://www.gantry.org/";s:8:"sections";a:4:{s:11:"description";s:2417:"<blockquote>
<p>Gantry 5 is now available for WordPress! Please visit <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/gantry5/" title="Gantry 5">Gantry 5</a> plugin page for more informations.</p>
</blockquote>
<p>Gantry 4 is a comprehensive set of building blocks to enable the rapid development and realization of a design into a flexible and powerful web platform theme.</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Please visit http://gantry.org to download a FREE WordPress Gantry 4 default theme which can be used as a base for your own themes!</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>For official RocketTheme Gantry forum please visit http://www.rockettheme.com/forum/gantry-framework</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>Gantry 4 is packed full of features to empower the development of designs into fully functional layouts with the absolute minimum of effort and fuss.</p>
<ul>
<li>True &#8220;Drag and Drop&#8221; page builder</li>
<li>Support for Responsive Layouts</li>
<li>LESS support</li>
<li>Syntax highlight support via Google Code Prettify</li>
<li>960 Grid System</li>
<li>Stunning Administrator interface</li>
<li>XML driven and with overrides for unprecedented levels of customization</li>
<li>Per override level control over any configuration parameter</li>
<li>Preset any combination of configuration parameters, and save custom presets</li>
<li>RTL language support</li>
<li>Built-in CSS and JS compression and combination</li>
<li>Flexible grid layout system for unparalleled control over block sizes</li>
<li>Optimized codebase with speed, size, and reuse core tenets of the framework design</li>
<li>65 base widget positions</li>
<li>38 possible layout combinations for mainbody and sidebars</li>
<li>Source-ordered 4 column mainbody</li>
<li>Many built-in widgets and gizmos such as font-sizer, Google Analytics, to-top smooth slider, IE6 warning message, etc.</li>
<li>Ability to force &#8216;blank&#8217; widget positions for even more advanced layout customization</li>
<li>Flexible parameter system with ability to set parameters via URL, Cookie, Session, Presets, etc.</li>
<li>Table-less HTML overrides</li>
<li>Standard typography and WordPress core element styling</li>
<li>ini-based configuration storage for easy portability</li>
<li>Automatic per-browser-level CSS and JS control</li>
</ul>
<p>For video tutorials and documentation please visit official <a href="http://gantry.org/" title="Gantry Framework" rel="nofollow">Gantry Framework</a> site.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:825:"<p>This section describes how to install the plugin and get it working.</p>
<p>Using WordPress plugin installer :</p>
<ol>
<li>Go to the Admin Dashboard &gt; Plugins &gt; Add New</li>
<li>From the top list select &#8216;Upload&#8217;</li>
<li>Point the Browse window to the plugin zip package</li>
<li>Activate the plugin in Admin Dashboard &gt; Plugins </li>
</ol>
<p>Using FTP :</p>
<ol>
<li>Extract the zip package with the plugin</li>
<li>Upload the plugin directory to the wp-content/plugins/</li>
<li>Activate the plugin in Admin Dashboard &gt; Plugins</li>
</ol>
<p>Please note that Gantry 4 Framework plugin doesn&#8217;t come up with the default theme. In order to download the Gantry Default theme please go to the <a href="http://gantry.org/" title="Gantry Framework" rel="nofollow">Gantry Framework</a> site.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:1211:"
<h4>What are the requirements of the plugin ?</h4>
<p>
<p>We try to ensure that any Gantry 4 theme and the Gantry Plugin specifically will work with any modern and secure server environment. The recommended minimum requirements are :</p>
<ul>
<li>WordPress 3.2 or higher</li>
<li>PHP 5.2+</li>
<li>MySQL 3.23 (5+ recommended)</li>
<li>Apache 1.3 (2.2+ recommended)</li>
<li>mod_mysql</li>
<li>mod_xml</li>
<li>mod_zlib</li>
</ul>
</p>
<h4>Where are the options of the plugin ?</h4>
<p>
<p>The plugin itself doesn&#8217;t have any options as everything is theme powered. Gantry Framework plugin is working in the background providing the functionality to the Gantry powered themes allowing them to control everything per-theme basis . You can download a basic Gantry theme from the official <a href="http://gantry.org/" title="Gantry Framework" rel="nofollow">Gantry Framework</a> site.</p>
</p>
<h4>How can I test it ?</h4>
<p>
<p>Once you downloaded and installed Gantry 4 Framework plugin, please download also a default theme (that is intended to be used as a basis for building your own themes) from <a href="http://gantry.org/" title="Gantry Framework" rel="nofollow">Gantry Framework</a> site.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:18940:"<h4>4.1.16</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed YOAST gizmo</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.1.15</h4>
<ul>
<li>Various PHP 7.2 fixes</li>
<li>Other minor fixes and improvements</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.1.14</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed JS errors caused by YOAST SEO on Gantry 4 Theme Settings page making it unusable.</li>
<li>Added an Gizmo option to enable/disable YOAST SEO JS on Widgets page in order to make the Gantry 4 MooTools scripts usable. You need to copy &#8220;yoastwidgets&#8221; fields from Gantry 4 default themes templateDetails.xml to your own theme to be able to enable and disable this functionality.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.1.13</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix regression in widget rendering on non-existing positions</li>
<li>PHP 7 compatibility fixes</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.1.12</h4>
<ul>
<li>PHP 7 compatibility fixes</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.1.11</h4>
<ul>
<li>PHP 7 compatibility fixes</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.1.10</h4>
<ul>
<li>WARNING! &#8211; PLEASE MAKE A DATABASE BACKUP BEFORE UPDATING</li>
<li>Auto execute script that will attempt to fix the widgets with wrong IDs in WP 4.4. Some widgets with bad data inside of them might need to be placed again.</li>
<li>Fix for wrong Widget IDs when placing them in WP 4.4</li>
<li>Encode the serialized cache data with base64 to avoid errors when unserializing in WP 4.4</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.1.9</h4>
<ul>
<li>Various style fixes for WordPress 4.4</li>
<li>Fixed deprecated constructor class in Divider Widget</li>
<li>Fixed a bug in Taxonomy facttype where it wasn&#8217;t limited to arrays only</li>
<li>Fixed StrictStandard notice in loadposition gizmo</li>
<li>Updated FontAwesome to 4.5.0</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.1.8</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed fallback to en_US language file if the localized .mo file doesn&#8217;t exist</li>
<li>Fixed Fatal Error that could occur when WPML ICL_Language_Switcher class is missing</li>
<li>Changed display of plugin name to Gantry 4 Framework</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.1.7</h4>
<ul>
<li>Updated FontAwesome to 4.4.0</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.1.6</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed XSS security vulnerability &#8211; thanks to Ingo Chao @ingochao for reporting</li>
<li>Replaced .live deprecated jQuery call in gantry-widgets.js</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.1.5</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed layout issues when using WPML and multilingual widgets</li>
<li>Fixed strict standards error in invertPositionOrder for RTL languages</li>
<li>Fixed Warning caused by $gantry being null when using WPTouch</li>
<li>Fixed RTL notices caused by using deprecated get_bloginfo calls</li>
<li>Added wp_nonce_field() to the Login Form widget</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.1.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed potential security risk</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.1.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Updated FontAwesome to 4.3.0</li>
<li>Updated compatibility for the bbPress</li>
<li>Fix for the Warning in GantryGZipper</li>
<li>Fixed issue that could prevent LESS from compiling on Windows machines when site directory had spaces in the name</li>
<li>Improved WPML compatibility ie. assigning overrides per language, translatable Gantry Widget input fields, Widget Variations for WPML Language Switcher widget etc.</li>
<li>Reverted language strings in Gantry Default Theme to WP core native approach with hardcoded text domains for WPML compatibility (some themes will require update) &#8211; please check Gantry Framework documentation for more info</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.1.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed FontAwesome font files paths in the WordPress Multisite</li>
<li>Modified get_content_template to support only current page context, leaving the post formats to the template</li>
<li>Modified the Gantry Breadcrumbs widget to support more formats and support filters</li>
<li>Fixed issue when wp_enqueue_scripts hook was fired too late</li>
<li>It is now possible to load scripts in the footer using addScript(s), addInlineScript, addDomReadyScript and addLoadScript</li>
<li>Revamped the Widget Variation Chooser to be much more flexible and usable (requires minor theme changes)</li>
<li>Widget input fields should now properly use data allowed in wp_filter_post_kses ie. some HTML code</li>
<li>Fixed assigning taxonomy archives to overrides</li>
<li>$gantry-&gt;displayBodyTag() allows now to use the same parameters as body_class()</li>
<li>Added widget_title filter to the Gantry Framework core widgets</li>
<li>Added compatibility for the WP Menu Cart plugin</li>
<li>Added missing BuddyPress Notifications Component to the possible Assignments list</li>
<li>Moved Analytics to Universal Analytics</li>
<li>Possible fix for some minor Font Awesome 3.0 issues</li>
<li>Fixed compatibility for NextGen Gallery</li>
<li>Minor UI improvements</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.1.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix for the JS error when editing Widgets in the overrides which could cause widgets to disappear</li>
<li>Fix for the gantryUrl that could prevent some scripts from using SSL</li>
<li>Changed CSS margins for the Gantry Widget forms to fix spacing</li>
<li>Fixed loading font variants for Google Fonts</li>
<li>Updated Google Fonts catalogue to support all currently available fonts and variants</li>
<li>Fixes for the Strict Standard notices in PHP 5.4 when debug mode enabled</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.1.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Compatibility fix in the MooRainbow for the Visual Composer plugin</li>
<li>RokBox 2 support in the Login Button widget</li>
<li>Fix for the multiple body classes in Page Suffix gizmo</li>
<li>Updated IE11 detection</li>
<li>Updated Pretty Print JS files</li>
<li>Fixed font style issues caused by FontAwesome 3.2.1 icons</li>
<li>Added Font Awesome 4 assets for future use</li>
<li>Fixed missing special characters with Google fonts ie. Polish characters</li>
<li>Removed RocketTheme references in Copyright widget</li>
<li>Fixed the display of overrided options in the theme settings</li>
<li>Gantry admin UI fixes for the WordPress 3.8</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.8</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added core support for the BuddyPress 1.8+ &#8211; Gantry BuddyPress plugin is no longer required and has been deprecated</li>
<li>Fix for the Gizmo options not being saved/loaded in the Presets of the theme</li>
<li>Compatibility fix for the NextGen Gallery plugin</li>
<li>Fixed rendering of the dollar sign ($) in the site title</li>
<li>You can now use the %YEAR% and %year% in the Gantry Copyright widget to display the current year</li>
<li>Fix for the bad path to the font files of the FontAwesome 3.2.1</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.7</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added support for Font Awesome 3.2.1</li>
<li>Added in performance improvement for Menus in the Rules Engine (thanks David Fritsch)</li>
<li>Added Gantry Mobile Dectect core utility (required by some premium templates ie. Lumiere)</li>
<li>Added two new admin form fields &#8211; filelist and imagelist</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.6</h4>
<ul>
<li>Cart66 support added to compatibility gizmo</li>
<li>Shopp plugin compatibility fix</li>
<li>Fixed parseQueryString method on override widgets that wasn&#8217;t allowing the &#8220;+&#8221; caracther in text</li>
<li>Google Web Fonts should now use proper protocol when SSL detected</li>
<li>Filter in Title gizmo should now have all required parameters</li>
<li>Changed the way how Gantry outputs header and footer which can solve potential issues with scripts and regular expressions</li>
<li>Gantry Menu cache should now respect the get_locale();</li>
<li>Other minor improvements</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.5</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed Google WebFonts and breaking fonts caused by s: and g: added to font body class</li>
<li>You can now keep your Gantry Framework translation files (.mo) in the WordPress languages directory ie. wp-content/languages/gantry/</li>
<li>Gantry is now going to automatically add the templateName-custom.css file if found under css/ directory</li>
<li>Added fix for the WP SEO when &#8220;Force Rewrite Titles&#8221; enabled</li>
<li>Title gizmo should now respect the wp_title filter</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a bug introduced in 4.0.3 where CSS files could load with double slashes</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed compatibility with WordPress Multi Site installations</li>
<li>Fixed a notice where siteurl option didn&#8217;t had path set</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Reverted some CSS changes in gantry.css which could cause some bad color appearance in couple themes</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Next Gantry Framework Major Release. Please always do a full backup (files + database) of your site before upgrading!</li>
<li>Fixed incompatibility with PHP 5.2</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Next Gantry Framework Major Release. Please always do a full backup (files + database) of your site before upgrading!</li>
<li>LESS support</li>
<li>Responsive layouts are fully supported</li>
<li>Brand new Admin UI</li>
<li>Caching improvements</li>
<li>Filtering in the Assignments tab</li>
<li>Ability to choose a chrome per widget</li>
<li>Support for the new Dropdown menu</li>
<li>New Search Highlight gizmo to allow to highlight search query without losing page content formatting</li>
<li>Added back the gantryjson.class.php file for backwards compatibility with Crystalline</li>
<li>Many more!</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.31</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix for the caching issue which caused the &#8220;Fatal error: Call to a member function getGridcss()&#8221;</li>
<li>Please clean your site/browser cache after updating Gantry to 1.31</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.30</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix for the &#8220;Fatal error: Call to a member function isEnabled()&#8221; in some rare cases</li>
<li>Fixed Notices appearing after enabling Debug mode</li>
<li>Fix to keep accessibility mode disabled</li>
<li>Fixed overrides behavior involving presets</li>
<li>Fixed overrides badges opacity</li>
<li>Removed some unnecessary CSS for the future theme compatibility</li>
<li>Framework modifications to allow usage of responsive layouts in the future</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.29</h4>
<ul>
<li>BBPress is now fully supported</li>
<li>Added Maintenance Mode gizmo</li>
<li>Jigoshop compatibility fix</li>
<li>Fixed JS issue with gantry-layer that could block admin in certain themes (ie. Panacea)</li>
<li>Compatibility fixes for WordPress 3.5</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.28</h4>
<ul>
<li>Much improved 3rd party plugin compatibility &#8211; please note that you need to update your theme for this to work</li>
<li>WooCommerce gizmo is now Compatibility gizmo which will be used to add support to various 3rd party plugins and keep them in one place</li>
<li>Add to Cart should now work fine with the WooCommerce product variants</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.27</h4>
<ul>
<li>Small CSS fix for the RTL featured image</li>
<li>Updated the version of MooTools to 1.4.5 with compatibility layer</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.26</h4>
<ul>
<li>Gantry now properly loads the widget_admin.css file</li>
<li>Added missing CSS and JS code for the &#8220;selectedset&#8221; field type</li>
<li>Added missing charset  tag in the displayHead function</li>
<li>Proper fix for the Children items in the Mobile Menu</li>
<li>Display Single Post Category in Breadcrumbs widget is on by default</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.25</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix for custom post types and loop hierarchy not properly supported</li>
<li>Fix for missing $this in the gantrybodylayout.class.php</li>
<li>Custom Post Type archive theme files should be now loading properly</li>
<li>Fix a bug when certain options wouldn&#8217;t be activated after reloading override settings</li>
<li>Fix for the overflow in the admin area</li>
<li>Fix for CSS overflow in the Mobile Menu</li>
<li>Added WooCommerce support</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.24</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix for the Warning:preg_match() on the Widgets page when The Events Calendar plugin was activated (possible solution for similar issues with other plugins)</li>
<li>Added some small CSS fixes for font-size of the meta elements</li>
<li>Gantry iPhone Menu is now a Gantry Mobile Menu as it works both on iPhone and Android platforms</li>
<li>Fix for the same domain check which could cause issues ie. with WordPress MU Domain Mapping</li>
<li>Fixed some Ajax behavior on the widget overrides page</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.23</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed the z-index of WordPress screen meta tabs on the widgets page</li>
<li>Added CSS code used for multi-column blog view</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.22</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added support for the custom variations in widgets (custom CSS classes)</li>
<li>Fixed the count widgets in WP 3.3 theme settings page</li>
<li>Fixed the z-index value of the WP 3.3 flyout menus on admin pages with Gantry Overrides bar</li>
<li>Fixed Clear Cache button and Presets switcher</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.21</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed the incrementation bug in the bugfix.php script which could cause a widgets id conflict</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.20</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added a fix to prevent frozen widgets and widgets appearing in wrong overrides</li>
<li>Added a script that should automatically fix all existing frozen widgets and overrides</li>
<li>Added support for WordPress Multi Site installations</li>
<li>Added check for instance settings of WordPress widget classes</li>
<li>The $ signs in page titles should be now displayed properly</li>
<li>Added require_once parameter to the locate_type function</li>
<li>Updated the SmartLoad gizmo JS file to fix XPath Ignores</li>
<li>Fixed the situation when the MooTools would only get loaded when the Build Spans gizmo is enabled</li>
<li>Fixed the situation when front-page.php file wouldn&#8217;t get loaded from the proper location</li>
<li>Modified the MU Register gizmo to add very basic width settings to the activate and signup pages</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.19</h4>
<ul>
<li>Adjusted for WordPress plugin directory</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.18</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed oddity in PHP 5.2.9 where some settings in the backend wouldn&#8217;t load</li>
<li>Added support for additional content type dirs</li>
<li>Added ability to filter out page title in Title gizmo</li>
<li>Added support for the 9 grid layout</li>
<li>Ability to define author name to appear as the page title in the theme settings page</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.17</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added widgets tooltips support</li>
<li>Fixed styling for the multiple instances of inner-tabs</li>
<li>Multiple instances of inner-tabs are now having default item selected</li>
<li>Changed Cache classname to RokCache for better compatibility</li>
<li>Upgraded mootools version</li>
<li>Upgraded RokNavMenu version to fix couple issues</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.16 Release</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added WP version check for compatibility with WordPress 3.2</li>
<li>Added new Google WebFonts</li>
<li>Added support for All In One SEO home page title in Title gizmo</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.15</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added support for the All In One SEO single post and single page titles</li>
<li>Added check to see if there&#8217;s more than 1 widget before any of the dividers in position</li>
<li>Fix for bad URL generated by the getCurrentUrl</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.14 Release</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed support for the ordered body layouts</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.13</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix for fusion menu dropdowns</li>
<li>JS Speed Optimization: Toggles, SelectBoxes, Gradients, ColorChooser, use a more smart way to get initialized and on load time nothing is initialized until you interact with a field (backward compatible).</li>
<li>Admin Tips now allow IDs to better manage the tips XML files (backward compatible).</li>
<li>Load page size saved by 35-40%</li>
<li>Ability to display single post category in breadcrumbs</li>
<li>Added styling for textarea admin field</li>
<li>Removed Recent Comments default avatar styling in favor of rt-image class</li>
<li>Fix for widget divider first with nothing above in sidebar</li>
<li>Added LoadPosition gizmo which lets you to load different widget positions in your content using shortcode and positions ID ie. [loadposition id=&#8221;showcase&#8221;]</li>
<li>Fix for nested layout object reverts</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.12 Release</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added Categories admin field</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.11</h4>
<ul>
<li>Change to help prevent conflict with template modifiers like wptouch</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.10</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added input and tokens to the title gizmo</li>
<li>Added accessibility css code</li>
<li>Fixed bug with currentUrl not being set right</li>
<li>Moved base init to template redirect</li>
<li>Added user css code</li>
<li>Added Category field to the Recent Posts widget</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.9</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added better Cookie Path handling</li>
<li>Fixed widget override selection bug! Yee Ha!</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed Menu Items Assignments in Overrides</li>
<li>Fixed Preset Saver in the backend</li>
<li>Added RokStyle gizmo</li>
<li>Added AutoParagraph gizmo</li>
<li>Updated MooTools to 1.3</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.7</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added RTL css file support from gantry</li>
<li>Added Page Suffix gizmo</li>
<li>Modified the default comment styling</li>
<li>Logo points now to the Site URL not WP URL</li>
<li>Breadcrumbs &#8216;Home&#8217; button points now to the Site URL not WP URL</li>
<li>Added default styling and home image for the breadcrumbs</li>
<li>Moved the Home button in breadcrumbs to be widget powered</li>
<li>Fixed pagination position in RTL mode</li>
<li>Swapped left padding to right one for lists in RTL</li>
<li>Added get_header, get_footer, and get_sidebar actions to help plugin compatibility</li>
<li>Fixed Push pull for sidebars in RTL</li>
<li>Added Overlay field type</li>
<li>Added spans to links in certain widgets</li>
<li>Added default styling for Recent Comments widget</li>
<li>Breadcrumbs pathway will only appear on the single post or custom page</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed swapping widget IDs in overrides</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.5</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added check for empty widget positions in render</li>
<li>Gantry Logo widget &#8216;Per Style&#8217; setting is no longer hidden</li>
<li>Changed some JS binds to follow the new ES5 specs</li>
<li>Fixed Colorchooser and Gradient fields</li>
<li>Added cache removal to default widget and override widget ajax actions</li>
<li>Gantry Pages widget is adding extra &#8216;active&#8217; class for current page</li>
<li>Gantry Categories widget is adding extra &#8216;active&#8217; class for current category</li>
<li>Changed width and padding for the MU Register form</li>
<li>Fix for cache clear issues</li>
<li>Made widget instance overrides available to ajax calls</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added displayFooter function and supporting renders for themes.</li>
<li>Add mootools script in jstools gizmo</li>
<li>Fix for calling wp_head on the admin side.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix for layouts not reversing in RTL mode</li>
<li>Fix for Duplicating and missing CSS files</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added Minefield to the list of Browsers</li>
<li>Add support for Signup page to template page overrides</li>
<li>Force Widget Accessibility Mode off for Gantry Themes</li>

<li>Added base level diagnostics</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.1</h4>
<ul>

</ul>

Analytics Plugin for WordPress</h4>
<p>We believe that you shouldn&#8217;t have to hire a developer to add Google Analytics to your website. That&#8217;s why we built <a href="https://www.monsterinsights.com/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteversion" title="MonsterInsights" rel="friend nofollow">MonsterInsights</a>, a complete Google Analytics for WordPress plugin that&#8217;s EASY and POWERFUL.</p>
<p>MonsterInsights allow you to connect your WordPress website with Google Analytics, so you can see how visitors find and use your website, so you can keep them coming back. Simply put, we show you the stats that matter.</p>
<p>With almost 15 million downloads, MonsterInsights is the most popular Google Analytics plugin for WordPress.</p>
<p>At MonsterInsights, user experience is our #1 priority. That&#8217;s why we make it extremely easy for you to connect and view your Google Analytics reports from inside your WordPress dashboard. Our tracking settings and workflows make MonsterInsights the most beginner friendly google analytics plugin in the market.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>MonsterInsights Pro</strong><br />
  This plugin is the lite version of the MonsterInsights Pro plugin that comes with all the analytics features you will ever need including ads tracking, ecommerce tracking, custom dimensions tracking, popular post tracing, events tracking, and tons more. <a href="https://www.monsterinsights.com/?utm_source=wprepo&amp;utm_medium=link&amp;utm_campaign=liteversion" title="MonsterInsights" rel="friend nofollow">Click here to purchase the best Google Analytics plugin for WordPress now!</a></p>
</blockquote>
<p>We took the pain out of connecting with Google Analytics and made it easy. Here&#8217;s why over 1 million smart business owners, designers, and developers love MonsterInsights, and you will too!</p>
<p><span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class='youtube-player' type='text/html' width='640' height='390' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/nHZBUDceRt0?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></span></p>
<h4>Quick &amp; Easy Google Analytics Setup</h4>
<p>Easily setup Google Analytics on your site without touching any code. If you can point-and-click, then you can use MonsterInsights.</p>
<p>Google Analytics for WordPress plugin by MonsterInsights allows you to track your blog visitors easily and always stays up to date with the newest features in Google Analytics.</p>
<blockquote>
<p>It just works. Really easy way to insert Google Analytics tracking code and keep it there when switching themes. No need to copy/paste code anywhere. This is the best way to handle Google Analytics in WordPress.<br />
  Steven Gliebe</p>
</blockquote>
<h4>Google Analytics Dashboard + Real Time Stats</h4>
<p>MonsterInsights makes analytics easy. You can see your site’s performance at a glance with our Google Analytics Dashboard right inside your WordPress admin area.</p>
<p>With Google Analytics, there&#8217;s no need to wait till the next day to find out about traffic spikes or potential problems. You can get real time stats, so you can unlock the maximum potential revenue for each customer.</p>
<blockquote>
<p>Works everytime! This plugin has worked with every version of WordPress I’ve ever used. Very reliable.<br />
  Vineeta</p>
</blockquote>
<h4>Universal Tracking + Page Level Analytics</h4>
<p>MonsterInsights uses universal tracking, so you can track your users across devices and platforms. With demographics and interest reports, you also get a better understanding of your audience.</p>
<p>The page level analytics show you exactly which pages and sections on your website are the most popular.</p>
<p>You can also see how the users are finding your website, so you can better focus your marketing efforts.</p>
<blockquote>
<p>Analytics for PROs! This plugin brings it all, great features and helpful info to easily see what you are doing.<br />
  Frank van der Sluijs</p>
</blockquote>
<h4>eCommerce and Ads Tracking</h4>
<p>MonsterInsights Ecommerce addon helps you add Google Analytics Ecommerce tracking to your WordPress WooCommerce and Easy Digital Downloads store.</p>
<p>You can add eCommerce tracking with literally 1 click, and start tracking popular products, average order value, ecommerce conversion rate, and more.</p>
<p>With our Ads tracking addon, publishers can easily track the performance of their Google Adsense inside their Google Analytics dashboard.</p>
<h4>Custom Dimensions, Events Tracking, and More</h4>
<p>MonsterInsights allow you to take full advantage of all the powerful Google Analytics features such as custom dimensions, file download tracking, outbound link tracking, events tracking, performance tracking, and more.</p>
<blockquote>
<p>I like how simple it is for client users and how I can turn on the advanced features for myself to get all the details right.<br />
  Skip Shean</p>
</blockquote>
<h4>Full MonsterInsights Feature List</h4>
<ul>
<li>Quick and Easy Setup &#8211; Easily setup Google Analytics for WordPress with just a few clicks (no coding needed)</li>
<li>Real Time Stats &#8211; See real time stats inside your Google Analytics dashboard.</li>
<li>Universal Tracking &#8211; Get better insights with Google Analytics&#8217; universal tracking.</li>
<li>Google Analytics Dashboard &#8211; See the stats that matter from right inside your WordPress dashboard.</li>
<li>Ecommerce Tracking &#8211; Add Google Analytics tracking for WooCommerce and Easy Digital Downloads store.</li>
<li>Ads Tracking &#8211; Track your Google Adsense ads with Google Analytics.</li>
<li>File Download Tracking &#8211; Enable file download stats with just a click.</li>
<li>Link Tracking &#8211; Track your outbound link clicks with Google Analytics.</li>
<li>Events Tracking &#8211; Track custom button and banner clicks with Google Analytics.</li>
<li>Custom Dimensions Tracking &#8211; Enable Google analytics custom dimensions tracking for WordPress.</li>
<li>Author Tracking &#8211; See who&#8217;s the most popular author with Author tracking.</li>
<li>Popular Post Tracking &#8211; See which blog post and section is the most popular.</li>
<li>Custom Post Type Tracking &#8211; Track the performance of your custom post types.</li>
<li>Referral Tracking &#8211; See how visitors are finding your website to better focus your marketing efforts.</li>
<li>Performance Tracking &#8211; Control the performance rate and sample rate for your Google Analytics report.</li>
<li>Enhanced Link Attribution &#8211; Get better analytics with enhanced link attribution.</li>
<li>Google Analytics Tools &#8211; Helpful tools for Google analytics.</li>
<li>Want us to add something else? Suggest a feature and we&#8217;ll get it added!</li>
</ul>
<blockquote>
<p>Simple, yet powerful. Amazing piece of plugin, does exactly what expected and even more.<br />
  Matt Jaworski</p>
</blockquote>
<h4>Popular Google Analytics Tutorials</h4>
<ul>

</ul>
<h4>Note for Beginners</h4>
<p>Like all WordPress plugins, Google Analytics by MonsterInsights is only available for self-hosted WordPress sites. This means you will need to <a href="http://www.wpbeginner.com/wp-tutorials/how-to-properly-move-your-blog-from-wordpress-com-to-wordpress-org/" title="How to properly move from WordPress.com to WordPress.org" rel="friend nofollow">switch from WordPress.com to WordPress.org</a> if you want to use this plugin on your WordPress site.</p>
<p>For more details, see this infographic on <a href="http://www.wpbeginner.com/beginners-guide/self-hosted-wordpress-org-vs-free-wordpress-com-infograph/" title="Self Hosted WordPress.org vs Free WordPress.com" rel="friend nofollow">self hosted WordPress.org vs free WordPress.com</a></p>
