<h3>1.4</h3>
<ul>
<li>Replace legacy mfunc/mnclude/dynamic-cached-content functionality with a &#8220;wpsc_cachedata&#8221; cacheaction filter.</li>
<li>Added dynamic-cache-test.php plugin example wpsc_cachedata filter plugin.</li>
<li>Delete post, tag and category cache when a post changes from draft to publish or vice versa. Props @Biranit.</li>
<li>Update advanced-cache.php and wp-config.php if wp-cache-phase1.php doesn&#8217;t load, usually happening after migrating to a new hosting service.</li>
<li>Misc bugfixes.</li>
</ul>
<h3>1.3.2</h3>
<ul>
<li>Any mfunc/mclude/dynamic-cached-content tags in comments are now removed.</li>
<li>Dynamic cached content feature disabled by default and must be enabled on the Advanced Settings page.</li>
<li>Support for the mobile theme in Jetpack via helper plugin on script&#8217;s Plugins tab.</li>
</ul>
<h3>1.3.1</h3>
<ul>
<li>Minor updates to documentation</li>
<li>Fixed XSS in settings page.</li>
</ul>
<h3>1.3</h3>
<ul>
<li>mfunc tags could be executed in comments. Fixed.</li>
<li>More support for sites that use the LOGGED_IN_COOKIE constant and custom cookies.</li>
</ul>
<h3>1.2</h3>
<ul>
<li>Garbage collection of old cache files is significantly improved. I added a scheduled job that keeps an eye on things and restarts the job if necessary. Also, if you enable caching from the Easy page garbage collection will be enabled too.</li>
<li>Editors can delete single cached files from the admin bar now.</li>
<li>Fixed the cached page counter on the settings page.</li>
<li>Some sites that updated to 1.0 experienced too much garbage collection. There are still stragglers out there who haven&#8217;t upgraded but that&#8217;s fixed now!</li>
<li>Supercached mobile files are now used as there was a tiny little typo that needed fixing.</li>
<li>If your site is in a directory and you saw problems updating a page then that should be fixed now.</li>
<li>The deactivate hook has been changed so your configuration isn.t hosed when you upgrade. Unfortunately this will only happen after you do this upgrade.</li>
<li>Some sites use custom cookies with the LOGGED_IN_COOKIE constant. Added support for that.</li>
<li>Added support for WPTouch Pro, but it appears to be flaky still. Anyone have time to work on that? I don.t.</li>
<li>Some sites had problems with scheduled posts. For some reason the plugin thought the post was in draft mode and then because it only checked the same post once, when the post magically became published the cache wasn.t cleared. That.s fixed, thanks to the debug logging of several patient users.</li>
<li>And more bug fixes and translation updates.</li>
</ul>
<h3>1.1</h3>
<ul>
<li>Use $_SERVER[ &#8216;SERVER_NAME&#8217; ] to create cache directories.</li>
<li>Only create blogs cached directories if valid requests and blogs exist.</li>
<li>Only clear current blog&#8217;s cache files if navigation menu is modified</li>
<li>Added clean_post_cache action to clear cache on post actions</li>
<li>Removed garbage collection details on Contents tab</li>
<li>Added wp_cache_check_mobile cacheaction filter to shortcircuit mobile device check.</li>
<li>Don&#8217;t delete cache files for draft posts</li>
<li>Added action on wp_trash_post to clear the cache when trashed posts are deleted</li>
<li>Show a warning when 304 browser caching is disabled (because mod_rewrite caching is on)</li>
<li>New check for safe mode if using less that PHP 5.3.0</li>
<li>Added wp_supercache_remove_cookies filter to disable anonymous browsing mode.</li>
<li>Fixed garbage collection schedule dropdown</li>
<li>Fixed preload problem clearing site&#8217;s cache on &#8220;page on front&#8221; sites.</li>
<li>Fix for PHP variable not defined warnings</li>
<li>Fixed problem refreshing cache when comments made as siteurl() sometimes didn&#8217;t work</li>
<li>Preloading of taxonomies is now optional</li>
<li>Domain mapping fixes.</li>
<li>Better support for https sites. Remove https:// to get cache paths.</li>
<li>Added AddDefaultCharset .htaccess rule back in and added an option to remove it if required.</li>
<li>Added multisite plugin that adds a &#8220;Cached&#8221; column to Network-&gt;Sites to disable caching on a per site basis.</li>
<li>Added WPTouch plugin to modify browser and prefix list in mobile detection code. Added support for that plugin&#8217;s exclude list.</li>
<li>Fixed cache tester</li>
<li>Filter the tags that are used to detect end-of-page using the wp_cache_eof_tags filter.</li>
<li>Removed debug level from logging as it wasn&#8217;t helpful.</li>
<li>Removed mention of wp-minify.</li>
</ul>
<h3>1.0</h3>
<ul>
<li>Removed AddDefaultCharset .htaccess rule</li>
<li>Fixed problem with blogs in a folder and don&#8217;t have a trailing slash</li>
<li>New scheduling of garbage collection</li>
<li>Added a &#8220;Delete cache&#8221; link to admin bar to delete cache of current page.</li>
<li>Updated documentation</li>
<li>Sorry Digg, Stephen Fry power now!</li>
<li>Updated translations</li>
<li>Preload taxonomies and all post types except revisionsand nav menu items</li>
<li>Fixed previews by logged in users.</li>
<li>Added option to make logged in users anonymous</li>
<li>Use WP 3.0 variables to detect multisite installs</li>
<li>Hash filenames so files are served from the same CDNs</li>
</ul>
<h3>0.9.9.9</h3>
<ul>
<li>Fixed typo, is_front_page.</li>
<li>Serve repeated static files from the same CDN hostname.</li>
<li>Updated translations.</li>
<li>Make supercache dir lowercase to avoid problems with unicode URLs.</li>
<li>Add option to skip https loaded static content.</li>
<li>Remove 5 second check on age of existing cache files. Should help with posts that get lots of comments and traffic.</li>
<li>Lots of bugs fixed.</li>
</ul>
<h3>0.9.9.8</h3>
<ul>
<li>CDN updates: can be switched off, multiple CNAMEs.</li>
<li>Uninstall process improved. It removes generated files and fixes edited files.</li>
<li>Cached dynamic pages can now be stored in Supercache files and compressed.</li>
<li>1and1 Webhosting fix (/kunden/)</li>
<li>Remove log by email functionality as it caused problems for users who were inundated by email</li>
<li>Many more minor fixes and changes.</li>
</ul>
<h3>0.9.9.6</h3>
<ul>
<li>Fixed problem serving cached files with PHP</li>
<li>Added support for 304 &#8220;file not modified&#8221; header to help browser caching. (PHP caching only)</li>
<li>Added French &amp; German translations, updated Italian translation and fixed translation strings.</li>
<li>Sleep 4 seconds between preload urls to reduce load on the server</li>
<li>Updated docs and FAQs.</li>
</ul>
<h3>0.9.9.5</h3>
<ul>
<li>Disable compression on on easy setup page. Still causes problems on some hosts.</li>
<li>Remove footerlink on easy setup page.</li>
<li>Don&#8217;t delete mod_rewrite rules when caching is disabled.</li>
<li>Don&#8217;t stop users using settings page when in safe mode.</li>
</ul>
<h3>0.9.9.4</h3>
<ul>
<li>Settings page split into tabbed pages.</li>
<li>Added new &#8220;Easy&#8221; settings page for new users.</li>
<li>New PHP caching mode to serve supercached files.</li>
<li>Mobile support fixes.</li>
<li>Added Domain mapping support plugin.</li>
<li>Added &#8220;awaiting moderation&#8221; plugin that removes that text from posts.</li>
<li>Terminology change. Changed &#8220;half on&#8221; to &#8220;legacy caching&#8221;.</li>
<li>Fixed cache tester on some installs of WordPress.</li>
<li>Updated documentation</li>
<li>Added $wp_super_cache_lock_down config variable to hide lockdown and directly cached pages admin items.</li>
<li>Preloaded checks if it has stalled and reschedules the job to continue.</li>
<li>Serve the gzipped page when first cached if the client supports compression.</li>
<li>Lots more bug fixes..</li>
</ul>
<h3>0.9.9.3</h3>
<ul>
<li>Fixed division by zero error in half on mode.</li>
<li>Always show &#8220;delete cache&#8221; button.</li>
<li>Fixed &#8220;Update mod_rewrite rules&#8221; button.</li>
<li>Minor text changes to admin page.</li>
</ul>
<h3>0.9.9.2</h3>
<ul>
<li>Forgot to change version number in wp-cache.php</li>
</ul>
<h3>0.9.9.1</h3>
<ul>
<li>Added preloading of static cache.</li>
<li>Better mobile plugin support</li>
<li>.htaccess rules can be updated now. Added wpsc_update_htaccess().</li>
<li>Fixed &#8220;page on front&#8221; cache clearing bug.</li>
<li>Check for wordpress_logged_in cookie so test cookie isn&#8217;t detected.</li>
<li>Added clear_post_supercache() to clear supercache for a single post.</li>
<li>Put quotes around rewrite rules in case paths have spaces.</li>
</ul>
<h3>0.9.9</h3>
<ul>
<li>Added experimental object cache support.</li>
<li>Added Chinese(Traditional) translation by Pseric.</li>
<li>Added FAQ on WP-Cache vs Supercache files.</li>
<li>Use Supercache file if WP-Cache file not found. Useful if mod_rewrite rules are broken or not working.</li>
<li>Get mobile browser list from WP Mobile Edition if found. Warn user if .htaccess out of date.</li>
<li>Make sure writer lock is unlocked after writing cache files.</li>
<li>Added link to developer docs in readme.</li>
<li>Added Ukranian translation by Vitaly Mylo.</li>
<li>Added Upgrade Notice section to readme.</li>
<li>Warn if zlib compression in PHP is enabled.</li>
<li>Added compression troubleshooting answer. Props Vladimir (http://blog.sjinks.pro/)</li>
<li>Added Japanese translation by Tai (http://tekapo.com/)</li>
<li>Updated Italian translation.</li>
<li>Link to WP Mobile Edition from admin page for mobile support.</li>
</ul>
<h3>0.9.8</h3>
<ul>
<li>Added Spanish translation by Omi.</li>
<li>Added Italian translation by Gianni Diurno.</li>
<li>Addded advanced debug code to check front page for category problem. Enable by setting $wp_super_cache_advanced_debug to 1 in the config file.</li>
<li>Fixed wordpress vs wordpress_logged_in cookie mismatch in cookie checking function.</li>
<li>Correctly check if WP_CACHE is set or not. PHP is weird.</li>
<li>Added wp_cache_clear_cache() to clear out cache directory.</li>
<li>Only show logged in message when debugging enabled.</li>
<li>Added troubleshooting point 20. PHP vs Apache user.</li>
<li>Fixed problem deleting cache file.</li>
<li>Don&#8217;t delete cache files when moderated comments are deleted.</li>
</ul>
<h3>0.9.7</h3>
<ul>
<li>Fixed problem with blogs in folders.</li>
<li>Added cache file listing and delete links to admin page.</li>
<li>Added &#8220;Newest Cached Pages&#8221; listing in sidebox.</li>
<li>Made admin page translatable.</li>
<li>Added &#8220;How do I make certain parts of the page stay dynamic?&#8221; to FAQ.</li>
<li>Advanced: added &#8220;late init&#8221; feature so that plugin activates on &#8220;init&#8221;. Set $wp_super_cache_late_init to true in config file to use.</li>
<li>Disable supercaching when GET parameters present instead of disabling all caching. Disable on POST (as normal) and preview.</li>
<li>Fixed problem with cron job and mutex filename.</li>
<li>Warn users they must enable mobile device support if rewrite rules detected. Better detection of when to warn that .htaccess rules must be updated (no need when rewrite rules not present)</li>
<li>Advanced: Added &#8220;wpsupercache_404&#8221; filter. Return true to cache 404 error pages.</li>
<li>Use the wordpress_test_cookie in the cache key.</li>
<li>Show correct number of cache files when compression off.</li>
<li>Fixed problem with PHP safe_mode detection.</li>
<li>Various bugfixes and documentation updates. See Changelog.txt</li>
</ul>
<h3>0.9.6.1</h3>
<ul>
<li>Move &#8220;not logged in&#8221; message init below check for POST.</li>
<li>Add is_admin() check so plugin definitely can&#8217;t cache the backend.</li>
<li>Add &#8220;do not cache&#8221; page type to admin page.</li>
</ul>
<h3>0.9.6</h3>
<ul>
<li>Add uninstall.php uninstall script.</li>
<li>Updated cache/.htaccess rules (option to upgrade that)</li>
<li>Added FAQ about category and static homepage problem.</li>
<li>Add wp_cache_user_agent_is_rejected() back to wp-cache-phase2.php</li>
<li>Show message for logged in users when caching disable for them.</li>
<li>Check filemtime on correct supercache file</li>
</ul>
<h3>0.9.5</h3>
<ul>
<li>Show next and last GC times in minutes, not local time.</li>
<li>Don&#8217;t serve wp_cache cache files to rejected user agents. Supercache files are still served to them.</li>
<li>If enabled, mobile support now serves php cached files to mobile clients and static cached files to everyone else.</li>
<li>Added checks for &#8220;WPSC_DISABLE_COMPRESSION&#8221; and &#8220;WPSC_DISABLE_LOCKING&#8221; constants to disable compression and file locking. For hosting companies primarily.</li>
<li>Added check for DONOTCACHEPAGE constant to avoid caching a page.</li>
<li>Use PHP_DOCUMENT_ROOT when creating .htaccess if necessary.</li>
</ul>
<h3>0.9.4.3</h3>
<ol>
<li>Added &#8220;Don&#8217;t cache for logged in users&#8221; option.</li>
<li>Display file size stats on admin page.</li>
<li>Clear the cache when profile page is updated.</li>
<li>Don&#8217;t cache post previews.</li>
<li>Added backslashes to rejected URI regex list.</li>
<li>Fixed problems with posts and comments not refreshing.</li>
</ol>

Yoast</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:42:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/joostdevalk";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.8";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.8";s:12:"requires_php";s:5:"5.2.4";s:6:"rating";d:98;s:7:"ratings";a:6:{i:5;i:21919;i:4;i:533;i:3;i:128;i:2;i:99;i:1;i:468;i:0;i:1;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:23148;s:15:"support_threads";i:416;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:369;s:10:"downloaded";i:132976059;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2018-10-09 7:50am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2010-10-11";s:8:"homepage";s:18:"https://yoa.st/1uj";s:8:"sections";a:4:{s:11:"description";s:5765:"<h3>Yoast SEO: the #1 WordPress SEO plugin</h3>
<p>Need some help with your search engine optimization? Need an SEO plugin that helps you reach for the stars? Yoast SEO is the original WordPress SEO plugin since 2008. It is the favorite tool of millions of users, ranging from the bakery around the corner to some of the most popular sites on the planet. With Yoast SEO, you get a solid toolset that helps you aim for that number one spot in the search results. Yoast: SEO for everyone.</p>
<p>Yoast SEO does everything in its power to please both visitors and search engine spiders. How? Below you’ll find a small sampling of the powers of Yoast SEO:</p>
<h4>Taking care of your WordPress SEO</h4>
<ul>
<li>The most advanced XML Sitemaps functionality at the push of a button.</li>
<li>Full control over site breadcrumbs: add a piece of code and you’re good to go.</li>
<li>Set canonical URLs to avoid duplicate content. Never have to worry about Google penalties again.</li>
<li>Title and meta description templating for better branding and consistent snippets in the search results.</li>
<li><strong>[Premium]</strong> Expand Yoast SEO with the News SEO, Video SEO, Local SEO and WooCommerce SEO extensions.</li>
<li><strong>[Premium]</strong> Need help? Yoast SEO Premium users get 1 year free access to our awesome support team.</li>
</ul>
<blockquote>
<p>Note: some features are Premium. Which means you need Yoast SEO Premium to unlock those features. You can <a href="https://yoa.st/1v8" rel="nofollow">get Yoast SEO Premium here</a>!</p>
</blockquote>
<h4>Write killer content with Yoast SEO</h4>
<ul>
<li>Content &amp; SEO analysis: Invaluable tools to write SEO-friendly texts.</li>
<li>The snippet preview shows you how your post or page will look in the search results &#8211; even on mobile. Yoast SEO Premium even has social media previews!</li>
<li><strong>[Premium]</strong> The Insights tool shows you what your text focuses on so you can keep your article in line with your keywords.</li>
<li><strong>[Premium]</strong> Multiple focus keywords: Optimize your article for synonyms and related keywords.</li>
<li><strong>[Premium]</strong> Automatic internal linking suggestions: write your article and get automatic suggested posts to link to.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Keep your site in perfect shape</h4>
<ul>
<li>Yoast SEO tunes the engine of your site so you can work on creating great content.</li>
<li>Our cornerstone content and internal linking features help you optimize your site structure in a breeze.</li>
<li>Integrates with Google Search Console: See how your site performs in the search engines and fix crawl errors.</li>
<li>Manage SEO roles: Give your colleagues access to specific sections of the Yoast SEO plugin.</li>
<li>Bulk editor: Make large-scale edits to your site.</li>
<li><strong>[Premium]</strong> Social previews to manage the way your page is shared on social networks like Facebook and Twitter.</li>
<li><strong>[Premium]</strong> Redirect manager: It keeps your site healthy by easily redirecting errors from Google Search Console, deleted pages and changed URLs.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Premium support</h3>
<p>The Yoast team does not always provide active support for the Yoast SEO plugin on the WordPress.org forums, as we prioritize our email support. One-on-one email support is available to people who <a href="https://yoa.st/1v8" rel="nofollow">bought Yoast SEO Premium</a> only.</p>
<p>Note that the <a href="https://yoa.st/1v8" rel="nofollow">Yoast SEO Premium</a> also has several extra features too, including the option to have multiple focus keywords, internal linking suggestions, cornerstone content checks and a redirect manager, so it is well worth your investment!</p>
<p>You should also check out the <a href="https://yoa.st/1uu" rel="nofollow">Yoast Local SEO</a>, <a href="https://yoa.st/1uv" rel="nofollow">Yoast News SEO</a> and <a href="https://yoa.st/1uw" rel="nofollow">Yoast Video SEO</a> extensions to Yoast SEO. They work with the free version of Yoast SEO already, and these premium extensions of course come with support too.</p>
<h3>Bug reports</h3>
<p>Bug reports for Yoast SEO are <a href="https://github.com/Yoast/wordpress-seo" rel="nofollow">welcomed on GitHub</a>. Please note GitHub is not a support forum, and issues that aren’t properly qualified as bugs will be closed.</p>
<h3>Further Reading</h3>
<p>For more info on search engine optimization, check out the following:</p>
<ul>
<li>The <a href="https://yoa.st/1v8" rel="nofollow">Yoast SEO Plugin</a> official homepage.</li>
<li>The <a href="https://yoa.st/1va" rel="nofollow">Yoast SEO Knowledgebase</a>.</li>
<li><a href="https://yoa.st/1v6" rel="nofollow">WordPress SEO &#8211; The definitive Guide by Yoast</a>.</li>
<li>Other <a href="https://yoa.st/1v9" rel="nofollow">WordPress Plugins</a> by the same team.</li>
<li>Follow Yoast on <a href="https://facebook.com/yoast" rel="nofollow">Facebook</a> &amp; <a href="https://twitter.com/yoast" rel="nofollow">Twitter</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h3>From within WordPress</h3>
<ol>
<li>Visit &#8216;Plugins &gt; Add New&#8217;</li>
<li>Search for &#8216;Yoast SEO&#8217;</li>
<li>Activate Yoast SEO from your Plugins page.</li>
<li>Go to &#8220;after activation&#8221; below.</li>
</ol>
<h3>Manually</h3>
<ol>
<li>Upload the <code>wordpress-seo</code> folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the Yoast SEO plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Go to &#8220;after activation&#8221; below.</li>
</ol>
<h3>After activation</h3>
<ol>
<li>You should see (a notice to start) the Yoast SEO configuration wizard.</li>
<li>Go through the configuration wizard and set up the plugin for your site.</li>
<li>You&#8217;re done!</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:124:"<p>You&#8217;ll find answers to many of your questions on <a href="https://yoa.st/1va" rel="nofollow">kb.yoast.com</a>.</p>
";s:9:"changelog";s:6817:"<h4>8.4.0</h4>
<p>Release Date: October 9th, 2018</p>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Fixes a bug where the cornerstone content toggle was available for attachment pages.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where the Search Console page displayed &#8216;first detected&#8217; and &#8216;last crawled&#8217; dates that were in the future.</li>
</ul>
<p>Enhancements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Introduces the <code>wpseo_taxonomy_content_fields</code> filter to add additional fields to the taxonomy metabox.</li>
<li>Adds a margin below select fields so there&#8217;s space between taxonomy settings for breadcrumbs. Props to <a href="https://github.com/emilyatmobtown" rel="nofollow">@emilyatmobtown</a></li>
</ul>
<h4>8.3.0</h4>
<p>Release Date: September 25th, 2018</p>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Fixes a bug where an incorrect time would be outputted in the <code>article:published_time</code> and <code>article:modified_time</code> meta properties when a timezone with numerical UTC offset was used (e.g. UTC+10).</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where the <code>article:published_time</code> and <code>article:modified_time</code> meta properties would be localized. Props to <a href="https://github.com/AminulBD" rel="nofollow">AminulBD</a>.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where the structured data rendered by the Gutenberg How-To and FAQ blocks was rendered on pages with multiple posts.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where snippet variables would not be replaced in the <code>og:description</code> of taxonomies when they were added in the Facebook Description input field.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where <code>babel-polyfill</code> would throw an error that there shouldn&#8217;t be two instances of babel-polyfill.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where the <code>bold</code> button was available in the How-to block&#8217;s step title and the FAQ block&#8217;s Question field while they were already bold by default.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug that caused keywords beginning with the Turkish characters <code>İ</code> / <code>i</code> and <code>I</code> / <code>ı</code> not to be recognized when changing that character from lowercase to uppercase and vice versa.</li>
</ul>
<p>Enhancements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Adds a colon to the list of possible title separators.</li>
<li>Adds a setting and filter (<code>wpseo_duration_text</code>) to the how-to block that allows users to edit the text describing the time needed.</li>
<li>Adds a help text to the readability analysis.</li>
</ul>
<p>Other:</p>
<ul>
<li>Adds a notice to the Yoast SEO dashboard that is shown when both Yoast SEO and All in One SEO Pack plugins are active.</li>
<li>Makes the duplicate content link on the archive settings open in a new tab. Props to <a href="https://github.com/nikhilbarar" rel="nofollow">nikhilbarar</a>.</li>
<li>Changes the notification message that is shown when a new SEO-related issue has been found.</li>
<li>Uses the correct type as the second argument of the <code>wpseo_sitemap_exclude_empty_terms</code> filter call when determining which taxonomies should have a sitemap. Props to <a href="https://github.com/liarco" rel="nofollow">liarco</a>.</li>
<li>Removes the executable bits on SVN assets. Props to <a href="https://github.com/mathieu-aubin" rel="nofollow">mathieu-aubin</a>.</li>
<li>Introduces an API function to get all Yoast SEO-related capabilities. Props to <a href="https://github.com/JoryHogeveen" rel="nofollow">JoryHogeveen</a>.</li>
<li>Changes the <code>@context</code> property from <code>http://schema.org</code> to <code>https://schema.org</code> in the FAQ and How-To block&#8217;s structured data output.</li>
<li>Rename the <code>associatedMedia</code> property in the FAQ and How-To block&#8217;s structured data output to <code>image</code>, to reflect a change in Google&#8217;s guidelines.</li>
<li>Moves the <code>@type</code> and <code>name</code> properties to the root of the FAQ block&#8217;s structured data output.</li>
<li>Nests the <code>Question</code> objects in the newly introduced <code>mainEntity</code> property in the FAQ block&#8217;s structured data output.</li>
<li>Removes the superfluous <code>position</code> property from the How-To block&#8217;s structured data output.</li>
</ul>
<h4>8.2.1</h4>
<p>Release Date: September 20th, 2018</p>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Fixes a bug where the Chrome or Opera browser tab would crash on Windows when a Polish text contains sentences in passive voice.</li>
</ul>
<h4>8.2.0</h4>
<p>Release Date: September 11th, 2018</p>
<p>Enhancements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Introduces a How-To block in Gutenberg to create a How-to guide in an SEO-friendly way. Read more about the Gutenblocks in [https://yoa.st/gutenblocks](our release post).</li>
<li>Introduces a FAQ block in Gutenberg to list your Frequently Asked Questions in an SEO-friendly way. Read more about the Gutenblocks in [https://yoa.st/gutenblocks](our release post).</li>
<li>Adds readability analysis for Polish.</li>
<li>On Multisite environments, in addition to the site domain, path and ID, also site titles are now present in the site selection dropdowns.</li>
</ul>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Fixes a bug where changing the WordPress slug would not correctly update the snippet editor.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where the user input would trigger an analysis every time.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug with incorrect zooming on older iPhones within the installation wizard.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where the OpenGraph image wouldn&#8217;t show correctly for the frontpage in a few situations. Props to <a href="https://github.com/mt8" rel="nofollow">@mt8</a> for the solution direction.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where the Yoast SEO network admin menu and admin bar menu would appear when the plugin was only active for the main site, and not for the entire network.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where snippet variables in the Twitter card title and description wouldn&#8217;t be properly replaced.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where a non-existing dependency was requested on the Search Appearance settings page.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where the value of the primary category snippet variable in the classic editor wouldn&#8217;t change when the primary category was changed.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where the Gutenberg editor in the Classic Editor plugin would crash when the primary category picker was loaded. If something goes wrong in the primary category picker, it now shows a notification, instead of making the entire editor crash.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where the readability analysis would not show the correct scores for cornerstone content.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where switching off the SEO analysis would stop the readability analysis from loading.</li>
<li>Fixes a fatal error on the Term and Post edit pages when the server is running on PHP 5.2.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Earlier versions</h4>
<p>For the changelog of earlier versions, please refer to https://yoa.st/yoast-seo-changelog</p>
